With 30 Wins In 50 Tests, Virat Kohli Is The Third Most Successful Captain In History In Winning Percentage

With 30 Wins In 50 Tests, Virat Kohli Is The Third Most Successful Captain In History In Winning Percentage

India's second test win over South Africa not only game them a 11th consecutive home series win, but it also helped captain Virat Kohli to another milestone as well.

AFP

After winning the first Test convincingly, India went on to hammer South Africa by an innings and 137 runs in the second game in Pune. The run machine Kohli was undoubtedly was the star of the show with an unbeaten 254.

AP

But it was the win that was more prolific and historic for India's most successful Test captain.

In his landmark 50th Test as captain, Kohli got his 30th win. The victory meant the Indian captain now has a win percentage of 60, only Steve Waugh (37 wins after 50 Tests) and Ricky Ponting (35 wins after 50 Tests) for any captain after 50 matches.

While Steve Waugh has a win percentage of 71.92, Ricky Ponting stands on 62.33.

BCCI

Kohli now has 17 wins in 23 home games and 13 in 27 away Tests.

After taking over from MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli has led the team from the front and is achievement remarkable new records with each passing day.

He will look to add another victory in the third Test and finish the series on a high.
